comment:
Challenging and content-heavy course delivered with lengthy PowerPoint lectures. Pala's communication may not be most engaging, but he makes an effort to create a supportive and welcoming environment. Proactive study tools are best for success. Frequent HW with each chapter. Attendance is NOT mandatory.

3 Exams, in-person, closed-note.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Secure a good group early for the project. The grade is largely made up of three exams (counts the highest two), a final, the group project, and a few homework assignments. Attendance was not mandatory except for the four days when groups are presenting. If you do well on the group project, you are likely to do well in the class.
He is the best choice for consumer behivior class!!! I'm glad I switch to his class in the last min.

The workload is acceptable for this class, as long as you submit everything on time and everyone in your group is doing their part(IMPORTANT!!! need to keep eyes on your group mate), you should be able to get nice grade. The content of this class is not so attractive. The professor is quite young and friendly. I enjoy to talk with him after class.

This professor is nice, but his classes are very boring, I recommend just reviewing the material on d2l. The exams are webcam lockdown browser. There's a humongous project throughout the semester that he grades pretty harshly so choose good partners and do a great presentation. Overall, he's ok, but I really didn't learn anything about marketing.

This was not a favorite class. Teacher was not very enthusiastic about the material. He assigns an extra-large group project which he doesn't grade until the last minute. On top of that there are multiple tests.

Better take this class with someone you already know to help safeguard your grade. If your group mate suck, you will get bad grade too. This professor is really strict about deadline, if you need an extension or something, be prepared to provide solid proof.

Professor Pala's class was super easy, the first test was open note/no camera, and the rest were all lockdown with camera. The final was cumulative but it focused more on the most recent chapters. The lowest test grade gets dropped. Group project was the major assignment for this class. Attendance is only counted when it's presentation week.

An easy A if you do your work. I didn't attend class for lectures so I can't speak on that but i'd imagine they're pretty boring. The group project is the most important thing. First test is lockdown no camera, the next two test and the final are with webcam but as long as you go over the study guide you'll pass. Lowest test dropped
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class is hard to fail.  Unless u fail the group project bad. all are test were online with lockdown browser and webcam. everything was easy all the answers are online .He does grade the group project according to the rubric don't slack on the group project it will reflect in your grade. u have the WHOLE Semester no excuses.

comment:
The course is really easy and basic. 
As long as you find nice groupmates and always submit assignments on time. You probably will get an A. 
Light homework load!

This class wasn't to hard. The exams are not too hard, but the lectures were really boring. I would just read the PPT and you should be fine. The biggest thing in this class was the semester long group project. Get a good group early and you should be OK.
